body: Could you please build the mips and mipsel versions? Many thanks.
Yes, we can do this now that we have mips support in Go 1.8. Look for mips in the next release, unless something unforeseen happens.

Thanks, but I think their is some thing wrong. The CPU of my router is mipsel, could you please build a mpisel one. 

[RT-N56U_B1 /opt/home/admin]# syncthing
/opt/bin/syncthing: line 1: syntax error: unexpected "("
So the arch options seem to be `mips`, `mipsle`, `mips64`, `mips64le`. Is `mipsel` == `mipsle` maybe?
Here's a mipsle build coming up, lets see if that runs: https://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing-branch/429/
@calmh Thanks a lot for the release, I can hardly to find my board on mips, will try when get it.

I can run it on my router. But can not open the webpage(http://192.168.2.1:8384). The port 8384 is accepted. Router's IP is 192.168.2.1.

> GUI and API listening on 127.0.0.1:8384

Looks like it's only listening for connections from the router itself, not from other machines.

Edit the `config.xml`, change the GUI listen address to 0.0.0.0 from 127.0.0.1.
